legend:
1. (1,2) down: A rock-like deposit of organism skeletons that make up reefs.
2. (3,1) down: Either of two fleshy folds surrounding the mouth.
2. (3,1) across: An agent, such as yeast, that cause batter or dough to rise.
3. (1,5) across: A large bird of the ocean having a hooked beek and long,narrow wings.
4. (3,3) across: A resin derived from the sap of various pine trees.
5. (6,3) down: A smooth chery candy made from suger, butter, cream or milkwith flavoring.
6. (1,8) across: A snide, slightly stifled laugh.
7. (9,3) down: A solid cylinder or disk that fits snugly in a larger cylinder and moves under pressure as in an engine.
